title: 103_hr4074
content:
The Act is titled the "National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Coin Act." It specifies the coin specifications. The "National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Coin Act" authorizes the minting of five dollar gold coins and one dollar silver coins with specific weights, diameters, and compositions. The design of the coins will be emblematic of the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial, with inscriptions of the year "1994" and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The coins minted under the "National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Coin Act" will feature inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items under the Act. The Secretary will obtain gold for minting coins under existing law and silver only from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Minerals Stock Piling Act. The design for each coin will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with various organizations and reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Advisory Committee. The coins will be sold as legal tender and considered numismatic items. SEC. 5. SALE OF COINS.

Coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the cost of bullion, plus designing and issuing costs. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a discount. A surcharge of $35 per coin for five dollar coins and $7 per coin for one dollar coins is required.

SEC. 6. ISSUANCE OF THE COINS. SEC. 6. ISSUANCE OF THE COINS. The coins authorized under this Act shall be issued through the end of calendar year 1994 in uncirculated and proof qualities. Only one facility of the United States Mint may be used to strike each denomination and quality. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. The Secretary shall promptly pay surcharges received from coin sales to the Fund established under section 11. SEC. 9. AUDITS. The Comptroller General can examine National Park Service records related to surcharge expenditures. SEC. 10. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 10. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary ensures no cost to the Government for minting coins under this Act. Payment for coins must be received in full or secured by a guarantee. SEC. 11. NATIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS MEMORIAL MAINTENANCE FUND. The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Maintenance Fund is established as a revolving fund administered by the Secretary of the Interior. Monies for the Fund are raised through surcharges and donations, and it is used for maintenance, repairs, adding names of fallen officers, and security of the Memorial site. The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Maintenance Fund is used for various purposes, including providing educational scholarships to the families of fallen officers, disseminating information about the Memorial, and administering the Fund. The National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Maintenance Fund allocates 10 percent of its annual income or $200,000 in any 1-year period. The Fund is subject to budget and audit provisions of chapter 91 of title 31, United States Code.
